lead_paragraph: The fifth day of the World Cup was marked by two suspensions. United States center Paul Emerick was barred five weeks for a dangerous tackle on England flyhalf Olly Barkley on Saturday. Phil Vickery, the England captain, was suspended two games for tripping Emerick. The United States faces Tonga today in Montpellier, France.
